Smart Power Strip: Create a power strip that can be controlled and monitored through a smartphone app. This power strip can be programmed to turn on and off at specific times, and can also monitor energy usage to help users save money and reduce their carbon footprint.

Multi-Port Power Strip with USB Charging: Design a power strip with multiple USB charging ports, allowing users to charge multiple devices at once. This power strip can also have a built-in surge protector and a compact design to fit easily into any room.

Motion-Sensing Power Strip: Develop a power strip that can detect when a room is unoccupied and automatically turn off to save energy. This power strip can also have a built-in timer to turn off after a certain period of time, ensuring that it only turns on when needed.

Adjustable Power Strip: Create a power strip with adjustable voltage settings, allowing users to customize the amount of power delivered to their devices. This can be useful for people who need to charge multiple devices with different power requirements, such as a laptop and a smartphone.

Power Strip with Built-in Outlet Expander: Design a power strip with a built-in outlet expander, allowing users to add more outlets to their existing power strip. This can be useful for people who need to charge multiple devices at once and don't have enough outlets in their home or office.
